model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: How did the speech go? Hopefully you motivated some people to run. How about this? I need a motivational speaker to motivate me, to help motivate my friend to run again. Know anyone? 

[MEMORY]
User Description: Speaker A is from Venice Beach and has traveled to 20 countries, despite hating traveling but loving running. They picked up a yodel in their travels and come from a musical background, as their parents met in a high school choir. 

Relationship Description: Speaker A and Speaker B have a friendly and supportive relationship, with Speaker B providing motivational speeches and encouragement to Speaker A in their running goals. 

Event Description: Speaker A and Speaker B have shared moments of discussing marathon training, dealing with injuries like a sprained ankle, and planning to run together for the Alps marathon. Speaker A has also shared their love for singing and active lifestyle recommendations for Speaker B when feeling down. Speaker B mentioned missing his family while traveling for work and finding solace in nature and motivational speeches.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: How did the speech go? Hopefully you motivated some people to run. How about this? I need a motivational speaker to motivate me, to help motivate my friend to run again. Know anyone?

raw_prediction: Speaker B: I actually have a new speech coming up that I think you'll really enjoy. It's all about finding motivation in the little things, like the sound of the waves crashing on the beach or the feeling of a fresh breeze while running. I'll even throw in a yodel for good measure to keep things interesting!
